tree.title: TEEAL Support
tree.description: Triage for 1st-tier support to manage resolution of common issues and escalation to 2nd-tier when necessary

branch.content:
Have you obtained all of the required information and created a Jira issue?

  1. institution
  2. subscriber name & email address
  3. TEEAL machine
    • IP address
    • subnet mask
    • TEEAL version
    • TEEAL patch (if applicable)
  4. mastering batch where machine originated
  5. browser & OS of computer used to access TEEAL application

Obtain more details/specifics on the issue and add them to issue description

Ask appropriate questions based on the context, such as:

  • Can you currently access the TEEAL application?
  • Were you ever able to access it?
  • Will you describe the events that led up to you contacting support?
  • If you connect a monitor to the TEEAL machine, what is displayed on the screen?
  • etc...etc...

Categorize into one of the following categories using label field in Jira:

Email the subscriber and include the setup & configuration guide PDF as an attachment

Ask the following questions:

  1. At which step in the attached setup documentation did you encounter an error?
  2. What error message was displayed?

Email the subscriber

Ask the following questions:

  1. What subnets need access to the TEEAL application?
  2. Does the default subnet currently have access to the TEEAL application?

The 2013 release clearly identifies the default subnet in the network configuration page under the admin dashboard. For the 2012 release, you'll have to compute the default subnet using a combination of the TEEAL machine's IP address + subnet mask, both of which should have already been obtained. CIDR cheatsheet is your friend.

Example calculation of default subnet

  • IP address: 192.168.1.10
  • subnet mask: 255.255.255.0

The TEEAL application should be accessible from any device on the 192.168.1.0/24 subnet.

Email the subscriber and include the 2013 update installation PDF as an attachment

Ask the following questions:

  1. At what number in the included instructions did the update fail?
  2. What error message was displayed?

Add the email response as a SEPARATE comment in the JIRA issue

Assign the issue to the TEEAL ITS SUPPORT user.

Your job here is done
